meanings.definition: The state or quality of being seedy.
meanings.sent1: The seedinesses of the old building were evident in its peeling paint and broken windows.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood's seedinesses made it a less desirable place to live.
meanings.sent3: The seedinesses of the abandoned house were so extreme that even the rats avoided it.
meanings.sent4: The seedinesses of the city's underbelly were exposed during the investigation.
meanings.sent5: The seedinesses of the alley were a stark reminder of the area's decline.

meanings.definition: The condition of being run-down or disreputable.
meanings.sent1: The seedinesses of the motel were apparent in its flickering neon sign and stained carpets.
meanings.sent2: The seedinesses of the bar attracted a rough crowd.
meanings.sent3: Despite its seedinesses, the diner served the best pancakes in town.
meanings.sent4: The seedinesses of the abandoned warehouse gave it an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The seedinesses of the street corner made it a hotspot for illicit activities.
